metadata.competency_question: What known genes or pathways are implicated in minimizing Doxorubicin toxicity while preserving its anti-tumor efficacy for NF1?

properties.name: neurofibromin 1
properties.function: Stimulates the GTPase activity of Ras. NF1 shows greater affinity for Ras GAP, but lower specific activity. May be a regulator of Ras activity
properties.role_in_cq: Primary anchor gene. NF1 loss-of-function leads to constitutive Ras/MAPK activation driving tumor growth. Preserved anti-tumor efficacy requires targeting this pathway.

properties.name: DNA topoisomerase II alpha
properties.role_in_cq: Primary doxorubicin anti-tumor target. Inhibition of TOP2A causes DNA double-strand breaks in rapidly dividing tumor cells. Preserving this mechanism is essential for efficacy.

properties.name: DNA topoisomerase II beta
properties.role_in_cq: Key cardiotoxicity mediator. TOP2B is expressed in cardiomyocytes but not highly in tumors. Doxorubicin-TOP2B poisoning causes cardiotoxicity. Dexrazoxane depletes TOP2B to prevent this.

properties.name: NFE2 like bZIP transcription factor 2
properties.role_in_cq: Master regulator of antioxidant defense. Activating NFE2L2/NRF2 upregulates SOD2, NQO1, CAT, HMOX1 to detoxify doxorubicin-generated ROS, reducing oxidative toxicity.

properties.name: superoxide dismutase 2
properties.role_in_cq: Mitochondrial superoxide dismutase. Converts superoxide to hydrogen peroxide in mitochondria. Critical for detoxifying doxorubicin-induced mitochondrial ROS.

properties.name: NAD(P)H quinone dehydrogenase 1
properties.role_in_cq: Two-electron reductase that detoxifies quinones without generating semiquinone radicals. Directly relevant to doxorubicin (an anthracycline quinone) metabolism - reduces it without ROS generation.

properties.name: catalase
properties.role_in_cq: Decomposes hydrogen peroxide to water and oxygen. Part of NFE2L2-regulated antioxidant defense against doxorubicin-induced oxidative damage.

properties.name: heme oxygenase 1
properties.role_in_cq: NFE2L2-regulated cytoprotective enzyme. Degrades free heme (released during doxorubicin-induced oxidative damage) to biliverdin, carbon monoxide, and iron.

properties.name: KRAS proto-oncogene, GTPase
properties.role_in_cq: Direct substrate of NF1 RasGAP activity. NF1 loss leads to constitutive KRAS-GTP, hyperactivating the MAPK cascade. Primary driver of NF1-associated tumor growth.

properties.name: B-Raf proto-oncogene, serine/threonine kinase
properties.role_in_cq: KRAS effector in the MAPK cascade. KRAS-GTP activates BRAF, which phosphorylates MEK1/2. Part of the NF1-deregulated pathway.

properties.name: mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 1
properties.role_in_cq: Selumetinib target. MEK1 inhibition blocks the hyperactivated Ras/MAPK pathway downstream of NF1 loss, preserving anti-tumor efficacy while reducing pathway-driven proliferation.

properties.name: tumor protein p53
properties.role_in_cq: Doxorubicin activates TP53-mediated apoptosis in tumor cells via DNA damage. TP53 status affects both doxorubicin efficacy and toxicity profile.

properties.name: ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 1
properties.role_in_cq: P-glycoprotein drug efflux pump. Mediates doxorubicin resistance by pumping drug out of cells. Expression levels affect both efficacy and tissue-specific toxicity.
Only FDA-approved cardioprotectant against doxorubicin. Depletes TOP2B in cardiomyocytes, preventing doxorubicin-TOP2B poisoning without substantially affecting TOP2A-mediated anti-tumor activity.

FDA-approved for NF1-associated plexiform neurofibromas. Inhibits MAP2K1/MAP2K2, blocking the hyperactivated Ras/MAPK pathway downstream of NF1 loss. Preserves anti-tumor efficacy via pathway-targeted approach.
NRF2 activator that could upregulate antioxidant defenses (SOD2, NQO1, CAT, HMOX1) against doxorubicin-induced oxidative stress.
Activates NFE2L2/NRF2-mediated antioxidant response by disrupting KEAP1-NRF2 interaction.
Core pathway deregulated by NF1 loss. NF1 → KRAS → BRAF → MEK1/2 → ERK cascade.
Broader MAPK signaling context including NF1 regulation.
Ras signaling pathway where NF1 acts as a negative regulator.
Primary toxicity mitigation pathway. Contains NFE2L2, SOD2, NQO1, CAT, HMOX1 - genes whose activity reduces doxorubicin-induced oxidative damage.
NFE2L2/NRF2 regulatory pathway controlling antioxidant gene expression.
Antioxidant response element regulation by NRF2.

properties.title: Phase II Trial of Chemotherapy in Sporadic and Neurofibromatosis Type 1 Associated High Grade Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumors
Prevention of Heart Failure Induced by Doxorubicin With Early Administration of Dexrazoxane
properties.primary_outcome: Participants with 95% reduction in topoisomerase 2b from baseline

properties.title: ANTICIPATE: Prevention of Anthracycline-Induced Cardiac Dysfunction by Dexrazoxane
Fenofibrate in the Prophylaxis of Doxorubicin Induced Cardiotoxicity
properties.primary_outcome: Assessment of changes in ejection fraction

properties.title: Detection and Prevention of Anthracycline-Related Cardiac Toxicity With Concurrent Simvastatin
Phase I/II Study of Selumetinib (AZD6244) in Children With NF1 and Inoperable Plexiform Neurofibromas

properties.mechanism: NF1 neurofibromin stimulates GTPase activity of KRAS, converting active KRAS-GTP to inactive KRAS-GDP
KRAS-GTP activates BRAF in the MAPK cascade

properties.source_tool: Open Targets GraphQL drug(chemblId: CHEMBL53463) mechanismsOfAction

properties.mechanism: Off-target TOP2B poisoning in cardiomyocytes causes DNA double-strand breaks leading to cardiotoxicity
properties.source_tool: Open Targets GraphQL target(ensemblId: ENSG00000077097) knownDrugs

properties.mechanism: Dexrazoxane catalytically inhibits TOP2B, leading to its proteasomal degradation in cardiomyocytes, preventing doxorubicin-TOP2B complex formation
properties.evidence: NCT:03930680 primary outcome: 95% reduction in TOP2B at 8 hours
properties.source_tool: Open Targets GraphQL drug(chemblId: CHEMBL1738) mechanismsOfAction

properties.mechanism: DNA topoisomerase II inhibitor (catalytic, not poisoning)
properties.source_tool: Open Targets GraphQL drug(chemblId: CHEMBL1738) mechanismsOfAction

properties.mechanism: Dual specificity mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase 1 inhibitor
properties.source_tool: Open Targets GraphQL drug(chemblId: CHEMBL1614701) mechanismsOfAction
Open Targets GraphQL target(ensemblId: ENSG00000116044) knownDrugs

properties.mechanism: Keap1/Nrf2 inhibitor (disrupts KEAP1-NRF2 interaction, activating NRF2)
properties.source_tool: Open Targets GraphQL target(ensemblId: ENSG00000116044) knownDrugs

properties.mechanism: NFE2L2/NRF2 transcriptionally activates NQO1 via antioxidant response element (ARE)
Doxorubicin is a substrate of ABCB1/P-glycoprotein efflux pump
properties.effect: Drug resistance and tissue-specific toxicity modulation
properties.source_tool: hgnc_get_gene(HGNC:40) — ABCB1 alias MDR1/P-gp known drug transporter
